physdesc.extent: 4 boxes (3 letter document containers and 1 half letter document container)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains miscellaneous office files of Sara Rios, former Director of the Human Rights and Governance Unit within the Peace and Social Justice Division at the Ford Foundation. Her office files contain conference files, reports, press materials, correspondence, and publications.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Sara Rios served as Director of the Human Rights and Governance Unit at the Ford Foundation from 2005-2012. Previously, she was the Program Officer for Racial Justice and Minority Rights from 2002-2005. Rios earned her Juris Doctor degree at the University of Toledo College of Law and was admitted to the Ohio Bar in 1986. Rios left the Ford Foundation in 2012 to become president of the Ruth Mott Foundation in Flint, Michigan. She passed away from ALS in 2015.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to RAC in 2018 by the Ford Foundation and ingested by RAC as Accession 2018:038.
